SourceText: üí° Learn about different emotions. There are 6 basic emotions that each send us a very specific message:

SourceText: üëÄSurprised: Stop and pay attention for a moment.

SourceText: üö©Afraid: Run away from danger.

SourceText: This lesson is about how we can stay calm and manage our anger when dealing with stressful moments with our children. üíö
text: Hierdie les gaan oor hoe ons kalm kan bly en ons woede kan beheer wanneer ons stresvolle oomblikke met ons kinders beleef. üíö

SourceText: As you began noticing feelings, you may have noticed feelings of anger, frustration or sadness.
text: Soos jy na gevoelens begin oplet het, sou jy gevoelens van woede, frustrasie of hartseer opgemerk het.

SourceText: üå∑ We love our children, but stress from caregiving and other events can make us feel angry. This is a normal part of life!
text: üå∑ Ons is lief vir ons kinders, maar die stres van versorging en ander gebeure kan ons laat kwaad voel! Dit is 'n normale deel van die lewe!

SourceText: üí° It is important for us to try to stay calm in order to help manage our anger so we do not hurt others.
text: üí° Dit is vir ons belangrik om te probeer om kalm te bly en so ons woede te help beheer sodat ons nie ander seermaak nie.

SourceText: When I am angry at my child, I should show that I am angry so they stop misbehaving.
text: Wanneer ek kwaad is vir my kind, moet ek wys dat ek kwaad is, sodat hulle kan ophou met hulle wangedrag.

SourceText: üíõ It can be very difficult when your child is misbehaving, but you should try to manage your own stress and control your anger before doing anything.
text: üíõ Dit kan baie moeilik wees wanneer jou kind hulle wangedra, maar jy moet probeer om jou eie stres en woede te beheer voordat jy enigiets doen.

SourceText: üå± Taking deep breaths will help. Being angry may cause you to say or do things you will later regret.
text: üå± Om diep asem te haal, sal help. Wanneer jy kwaad is, kan jy dalk dinge s√™ of doen wat jy later sal berou.

SourceText: Let‚Äôs see how {F1_FATHER} and {F1_DAUGHTER_13} spend one-on-one time together:
text: Kom ons kyk hoe {F1_FATHER} en {F1_DAUGHTER_13} een-tot-een tyd saam deurbring:

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚Äú{F1_DAUGHTER_13}, how was your day?‚Äù
text: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚Äú{F1_DAUGHTER_13}, hoe was jou dag?‚Äù

SourceText: **{F1_DAUGHTER_13}**: ‚ÄúMy day was good, {F1_FATHER}. I just came from school.‚Äù
text: **{F1_DAUGHTER_13}**: ‚ÄúMy dag was lekker, Pa. Ek kom nou van die skool af.‚Äù

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúI have 5 minutes of one-on-one time to spare before I have to drive to work again. What would you like to do together?‚Äù
text: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúEk kan 5 minute een-tot-een tyd afknyp voordat ek weer werk toe moet ry. Wat wil jy graag saam met my doen?‚Äù

SourceText: **{F1_DAUGHTER_13}**: ‚ÄúI was about to do my Science homework. The topic for the homework is to make something out of recycled materials. Could you please help me with it?‚Äù
text: **{F1_DAUGHTER_13}**: ‚ÄúEk wou nou net begin met my Wetenskap-huiswerk. Die onderwerp van die huiswerk is om iets uit herwinbare materiale te maak. Kan Pa my asseblief daarmee help?‚Äù

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúI would be happy to!‚Äù
text: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúEk sal dit met plesier doen!‚Äù

SourceText: **{F1_DAUGHTER_13}**: ‚ÄúI thought of building a recycled house using old bottles, boxes, and other recycled materials. Look! I picked these up on my way home. They were thrown away by the side of the road and outside the spaza shops.‚Äù
text: **{F1_DAUGHTER_13}**: ‚ÄúEk het gedink ek sal 'n herwinbare huis bou met ou bottels, bokse en ander herwinbare materiale. Kyk! Ek het hierdie goed op pad huis toe opgetel. Dis langs die pad en buite die spazawinkels weggegooi.‚Äù

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúWhat a good idea, {F1_DAUGHTER_13}! Sounds like you‚Äôve thought about this a lot and want to put a lot of effort into your homework. How do you want me to help you?‚Äù
text: **{F1_FATHER}**: "Wat 'n goeie idee, {F1_DAUGHTER_13}! Dit klink asof jy baie hieroor gedink het en baie moeite met jou huiswerk wil doen. Hoe wil jy h√™ moet ek jou help?"

SourceText: **{F1_DAUGHTER_13}**: ‚ÄúCould you help me clean these bottles? They will be the pillars of the house. I will make the boxes into the walls and roof of the house. Later, I thought we could paint the boxes and bottles so they look beautiful.‚Äù
text: **{F1_DAUGHTER_13}**: ‚ÄúKan Pa my help om hierdie bottels skoon te maak? Dit gaan die pilare van die huis wees. Ek gaan die bokse gebruik vir die mure en die dak van die huis. Ek het gedink ons kan later die bokse en bottels verf sodat hulle mooi lyk.‚Äù

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúI may have some leftover paint outside the house. I can take a look later.‚Äù
text: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúEk het dalk nog 'n bietjie oorskietverf buite. Ek kan later gaan kyk.‚Äù

SourceText: (Later in the day)
text: (Later die dag)

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúWow, it looks different now! It does not look like you used rubbish at all anymore. You also painted the walls and the roof beautifully! I think your teacher will be proud of you when she sees your homework!‚Äù
text: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúSjoe, dit lyk nou anders! Dit lyk glad nie meer asof jy rommel gebruik het nie. Jy het ook die mure en die dak pragtig geverf! Ek dink jou onderwyser gaan baie trots wees wanneer sy jou huiswerk sien!‚Äù

SourceText: **{F1_DAUGHTER_13}**: ‚ÄúThank you for your help, {F1_FATHER}. You know, there were a lot of fun things that happened in school today.‚Äù
text: **{F1_DAUGHTER_13}**: ‚ÄúDankie vir Pa se hulp. Weet Pa, daar het vandag 'n klomp prettige goed by die skool gebeur.‚Äù

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúGo ahead, tell me!‚Äù
text: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúMaar vertel vir my!‚Äù

SourceText: {F1_FATHER} and {F1_DAUGHTER_16} are spending one-on-one time by taking a walk together. {F1_DAUGHTER_16} looks very upset.
text: {F1_FATHER} en {F1_DAUGHTER_16} stap saam tydens hulle een-tot-een tyd. {F1_DAUGHTER_16} lyk baie ontsteld.

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚Äú{F1_DAUGHTER_16}, I noticed you have less energy today and you look sad. Do you want to talk about it?‚Äù
text: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚Äú{F1_DAUGHTER_16}, ek sien jy het vandag minder energie en jy lyk hartseer. Wil jy daaroor praat?‚Äù

SourceText: **{F1_DAUGHTER_16}**: ‚ÄúOh, {F1_FATHER}. I studied so hard for my maths test and failed. I feel so sad and frustrated.‚Äù
text: **{F1_DAUGHTER_16}**: ‚ÄúAg, Pa, ek het so hard vir my Wiskundetoets geleer en gedruip. Ek voel so hartseer en gefrustreerd.‚Äù

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúThat is frustrating, my girl. I know how hard you studied. Maybe we can come up with a new plan to help you with maths. Should we ask your teacher for extra help? Would you like me to talk to her or do you want to do it?‚Äù
text: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúDit is frustrerend, my kind. Ek weet hoe hard jy geleer het. Miskien kan ons met 'n nuwe plan vorendag kom om jou met Wiskunde te help. Moet ons jou onderwyser vra vir ekstra hulp? Wil jy h√™ ek moet met haar praat, of wil jy dit self doen?‚Äù

SourceText: **{F1_DAUGHTER_16}**: ‚ÄúThank you, {F1_FATHER}. I can do it! I think that might be a good idea.‚Äù
text: **{F1_DAUGHTER_16}**: ‚ÄúDankie, Pa. Ek kan dit doen! Ek dink dis dalk 'n goeie idee.‚Äù

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúYou know, maths may be difficult for you, but I am so proud of you for studying so hard, {F1_DAUGHTER_16}. Other people might give up, but you keep trying. That will help you so much in life!‚Äù
text: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúWeet jy, Wiskunde is dalk vir jou moeilik, maar ek is so trots op jou dat jy so hard leer, {F1_DAUGHTER_16}. Ander mense sou dalk tou opgegooi het, maar jy hou aan probeer. Dit sal jou in die lewe so baie help!‚Äù

SourceText: ‚≠ê Do some active exercise to shake out anger, give each other some space, or take some deep breaths to calm down. These are some ways to deal with your emotions.

SourceText: üå∑ Use actions and words to make your teen feel accepted and loved.

SourceText: This lesson is about how we can keep calm and manage our anger when dealing with stressful moments with our teens. üíö
text: Hierdie les gaan oor hoe ons kalm kan bly en ons woede kan beheer wanneer ons stresvolle oomblikke met ons tieners beleef. üíö

SourceText: üå∑ We love our teens, but stress from caregiving and other events can make us feel angry. This is a normal part of life!
text: üå∑ Ons is lief vir ons tieners, maar die stres van versorging en ander gebeure kan ons kwaad laat voel! Dit is 'n normale deel van die lewe!

SourceText: üí° It is important for us to stay in control and manage our anger so we do not hurt others.
text: üí° Dit is vir ons belangrik om in beheer te bly en ons woede te beheer sodat ons nie ander seermaak nie.

SourceText: True or False: When I am angry at my teen, I should show that I am angry so that they stop misbehaving.
text: Waar of Vals: Wanneer ek kwaad is vir my tiener, moet ek wys dat ek kwaad is, sodat hulle kan ophou met hulle wangedrag.

SourceText: üíõ It can be very difficult when your teen is misbehaving, but you should try to manage your own stress and control your own anger before doing anything.
text: üíõ Dit kan baie moeilik wees wanneer jou tiener hulle wangedra, maar jy moet probeer om jou eie stres en woede te beheer voordat jy enigiets doen.

SourceText: {F2_GRANDMOTHER} is about to spend one-on-one time with {F2_SON_15} but finds the living room in a mess. She notices that this makes her feel angry.
text: {F2_GRANDMOTHER} gaan nou een-tot-een tyd saam met {F2_SON_15} deurbring, maar sien die woonkamer is baie deurmekaar. Sy let op dat dit haar kwaad laat voel.

SourceText: ‚≠ê Before you focus on supporting others, it‚Äôs important to take care of yourself.
text: ‚≠ê Voordat jy op die ondersteuning van ander fokus, is dit belangrik om eers na jouself te kyk.

SourceText: üò£ Feeling stressed as your children grow up is normal. As your relationship with them changes, it‚Äôs important to handle this shift well, and that starts with self-care.
text: üò£ Om gestres te voel terwyl jou kinders grootword is normaal. Soos jou verhouding met hulle verander, is dit belangrik om hierdie tydperk goed te hanteer, en dit begin met selfsorg.

SourceText: üå± Self-care means doing things for yourself to reduce stress and make you feel better.
text: üå± Selfsorg beteken om dinge vir jouself te doen om stres te verlig en jou beter te laat voel.

SourceText: ‚è∞ Let‚Äôs learn a simple way to handle everyday stress: Taking a pause.
text: ‚è∞ Kom ons leer 'n eenvoudige manier om alledaagse stres te hanteer: Vat 'n blaaskans.

SourceText: ‚ôª We will use this skill frequently in future lessons, so it is important to learn it today!
text: ‚ôª Ons sal hierdie vaardigheid gereeld in toekomstige lesse gebruik, so dit is belangrik om dit vandag te leer!

SourceText: Taking a pause will help you manage stress and be more able to take care of others and yourself.üå±
text: Om 'n blaaskans te neem, sal jou help om stres te beheer en jy sal meer in staat wees om jouself en ander te versorg.üå±

SourceText: ‚ñ∂Ô∏èPress Play to practise taking a pause together.
text: ‚ñ∂Ô∏èDruk Speel om te oefen om saam 'n blaaskans te neem.

SourceText: Try taking a pause whenever you feel angry, overwhelmed, stressed or worried. ‚è∞
text: Probeer om 'n blaaskans te neem wanneer jy ook al kwaad, oorweldig, gestres of bekommerd voel. ‚è∞

SourceText: Even a few deep breaths or connecting with the ground beneath you can make a difference. You can also take a pause with your child or teen.
text: Selfs 'n paar diep asemhalings, of om kontak te maak met die grond onder jou, kan 'n verskil maak. Jy kan ook saam met jou kind of tiener 'n blaaskans neem.

SourceText: Try taking a pause on a daily basis, even if you are feeling calm. Doing this regularly will help your brain take a pause, even in challenging situations.
text: Probeer om op 'n daaglikse basis 'n blaaskans te neem, selfs al voel jy kalm. As jy dit gereeld doen, sal dit jou brein help om 'n blaaskans te neem, selfs in uitdagende situasies.

SourceText: Well done! üéâ You have learnt the importance of caring for yourself and how to take a pause. ‚ú®
text: Welgedaan! üéâ Jy het geleer van die belangrikheid om na jouself om te sien, en hoe om 'n blaaskans te neem. ‚ú®

SourceText: Thank you for providing a progress update. You can find and go through this course any time via the Main Menu by typing {MENU}.
text: Dankie dat jy jou vordering opgedateer het. Jy kan hierdie kursus vind en enige tyd via die Hoofkieslys weer daardeur gaan deur {MENU} te tik.

SourceText: How is one-on-one-time going?
text: Hoe gaan dit met een-tot-een tyd?

SourceText: Excellent! Keep up the good work in improving your relationship with your teen
text: Uitstekend! Gaan voort met die goeie werk om jou verhouding met jou tiener te verbeter

SourceText: Trying is what counts! Let's try to get this going GOOD!
text: Dit tel dat jy probeer! Kom ons probeer om dit GOED te kry!

SourceText: In the past 24 hours, did you spend at least 5 minutes of one-on-one time with your child?
text: In die afgelope 24 uur, het jy ten minste 5 minute een-tot-een tyd met jou kind deurgebring?

SourceText: That is okay. You will learn more about the importance of spending time with your child and how to do this in this course.
text: Dis oukei. Jy sal in hierdie kursus meer leer oor die belangrikheid daarvan om tyd met jou kind te spandeer, en hoe om dit te doen.

SourceText: That is great to hear! üéâ Spending time with your child is a great way to build a good relationship with them!
text: Dit is wonderlik om te hoor! üéâ Om tyd saam met jou kind deur te bring, is 'n wonderlike manier om 'n goeie verhouding met hulle te bou!

SourceText: Well done for completing the lessons on improving your relationship with your child. Let‚Äôs see how things have changed since you started:
text: Welgedaan dat jy die lesse oor die verbetering van jou verhouding met jou kind voltooi het. Kom ons kyk hoe dinge verander het vandat jy begin het:

SourceText: I am sorry to hear that you were unable to spend more time with your child. üíõ
text: Ek is jammer om te hoor dat jy nie meer tyd met jou kind kon deurbring nie. üíõ

SourceText: I am sorry to hear that you were unable to spend one-on-one time with your child. üíõ
text: Ek is jammer om te hoor dat jy nie een-tot-een tyd met jou kind kon deurbring nie. üíõ

SourceText: Congratulations on making some progress. It seems like spending time with your child may still be a challenge.
text: Geluk met die vordering wat jy reeds gemaak het. Dit lyk asof dit steeds 'n uitdaging is om tyd saam met jou kind deur te bring.

SourceText: You were already putting in the effort to spend one-on-one time with your child before ParentText. It‚Äôs great that you‚Äôre able to keep up the excellent effort!
text: Jy het voor ParentText reeds moeite gedoen met die deurbring van een-tot-een tyd met jou kind. Dis wonderlik dat jy in staat is om die uitstekende poging vol te hou!

SourceText: Time with your child is so important. Though you are still doing great, you have reported that spending one-on-one time together has become more challenging since you first began ParentText.
text: Tyd saam met jou kind is so belangrik. Alhoewel jy steeds goed doen, het jy gemeld dat dit 'n groter uitdaging geraak het om een-tot-een tyd saam deur te bring as toe jy met ParentText begin het.

SourceText: Congratulations! üéâYou‚Äôve made progress since you‚Äôve started ParentText. Your effort is working!
text: Veels geluk! üéâJy het vordering in hierdie kursus gemaak sedert jy ParentText begin het. Jou moeite word beloon!

SourceText: How is one-on-one time going?
text: Hoe gaan dit met een-tot-een tyd?

SourceText: Excellent! Keep up the good work in improving your relationship with your child.
text: Uitstekend! Gaan voort met die goeie werk om jou verhouding met jou kind te verbeter.

SourceText: What did you find difficult about spending time with your teen? üîë
text: Wat het jy moeilik gevind toe jy tyd met jou tiener spandeer het? üîë

SourceText: It can be hard to find time during your day, with work, chores, and everything else.
text: Dit kan moeilik wees om tyd in jou dag te vind met werk, huistake en alles.

SourceText: ‚ú®Think of a time each day that you could spare 5 minutes. You can even make household chores into a game to do together.
text: ‚ú®Dink aan 'n tyd elke dag waar jy 5 minute kan afknyp. Jy kan selfs huistake 'n speletjie maak om dit saam te doen.

SourceText: Use the time that you and your teens are already sharing, like eating a meal or saying goodnight before bed.
text: Gebruik die tye wat jy en jou tieners reeds deel, soos maaltye of nag s√™ voor bed.

SourceText: You can even make household chores into a game to do together.
text: Jy kan selfs huistake 'n speletjie maak wat julle saam kan doen.

SourceText: Type {PLAY} for a fun activity suggestion
text: Tik {PLAY} vir 'n pretaktiwiteit-voorstel

SourceText: üì∫ Teens often want to spend time watching T.V. or playing with a phone/tablet.
text: üì∫Tieners wil gewoonlik tyd spandeer deur T.V. te kyk of met 'n foon/tablet te speel.

SourceText: ‚ùì You could watch or play on the phone/tablet with them.
text: ‚ùìJy kan saam met hulle kyk of op die foon/tablet speel.

SourceText: üåà Caring about their interests is a great start!
text: üåà Om vir hulle belangstellings om te gee, is 'n goeie begin!

SourceText: üå∑ Once you begin spending time together, you can suggest another activity.
text: üå∑ Wanneer julle eers begin om tyd saam te spandeer, kan jy 'n ander aktiwiteit voorstel.

SourceText: Type {PLAY} for a fun activity suggestion.
text: Tik {PLAY} vir 'n pretaktiwiteit-voorstel.

SourceText: üì± Sometimes your teen will suggest activities that are violent or unsafe.
text: üì± Soms sal jou tiener gewelddadige of onveilige aktiwiteite voorstel.

SourceText: üö© Explain *why* you can't do them, and suggest a different activity.
text: üö© Verduidelik *waarom* julle dit nie kan doen nie, en stel 'n ander aktiwiteit voor.

SourceText: Type {PLAY} for a fun activity suggestion. üí°
text: Tik {PLAY} vir 'n pretaktiwiteit-voorstel. üí°

SourceText: ‚òÄÔ∏è If your teen wants to do things that are too difficult for you to do, you could watch them.
text: ‚òÄÔ∏è As jou tiener iets wil doen wat vir jou te moeilik is om te doen, kan jy toekyk terwyl hulle dit doen.

SourceText: üèÅ You could describe what they are doing like a sports announcer.
text: üèÅ Jy kan soos 'n sportkommentator beskryf wat hulle doen.

SourceText: You can also express enthusiasm by clapping, smiling, or giving them a thumbs-up.
text: Jy kan ook entoesiasme toon deur handeklap, glimlag of 'n duim in die lug.

SourceText: üíõ Praise them while they do it!
text: üíõ Prys hulle terwyl hulle dit doen!

SourceText: ‚öΩ Competitive games can be hard for teens (and adults!) if they don‚Äôt like losing.
text: ‚öΩ Kompeterende speletjies kan vir tieners (en volwassenes!) moeilik wees as hulle nie daarvan hou om te verloor nie.

SourceText: üèÜ When they have calmed down, talk with your teen about what winning well and losing well might look like.
text: üèÜ Wanneer hulle gekalmeer het, praat met jou tiener oor hoe 'n goeie wenner en 'n goeie verloorder sal optree.

SourceText: üìù Suggest other activities that you can do to work together instead of against each other.
text: üìù Stel ander aktiwiteite voor wat julle saam kan doen, in plaas van teen mekaar.

SourceText: üî¥ It can be difficult to spend one-on-one time with each of your teens when you have more than one.
text: üî¥ Dit kan moeilik wees om een-tot-een tyd met elke een van jou tieners te spandeer, as jy meer as een het.

SourceText: üå± If possible, you can ask an adult or older sibling to look after the other teens while you spend one-on-one time with one teen.
text: üå± Indien moontlik, kan jy 'n volwassene of ouer broer of sister vra om na die ander tieners te kyk, terwyl jy een-tot-een tyd spandeer saam met die een tiener.

SourceText: ‚è∞ Think of when it would be easier to spend one-on-one time with each of your teens. Perhaps later in the evening with your teen, after the others have gone to sleep.
text: ‚è∞Dink aan wanneer dit makliker sal wees om een-tot-een tyd saam met jou tieners te spandeer. Dalk later in die aand met jou tiener, na die ander reeds gaan slaap het.

SourceText: üíõ You can also spend one-on-one time with all of your teens at once! If you do, make sure all are able to participate in one-on-one time.
text: üíõ Jy kan ook een-tot-een tyd saam met al jou tieners gelyktydig deurbring! As jy dit doen, maak seker dat almal aan die een-tot-een tyd kan deelneem.

SourceText: Type {PLAY} and choose GROUP for a fun activity suggestion for a group of teens. üí°
text: Tik {PLAY} en kies GROEP vir pretaktiwiteit-voorstelle vir 'n groep tieners. üí°

SourceText: üíõ We are sorry to hear that you have been finding it hard to spend one-on-one-time with your teen.
text: üíõ Ons is jammer om te hoor dat jy dit moeilik gevind het om een-tot-een tyd met jou tiener deur te bring.

SourceText: üòî It can hurt when @fields.child_nickname does not want to spend one-on-one-time with you.
text: üòî Dit kan seermaak as @fields.child_nickname nie een-tot-een tyd met jou wil deurbring nie.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: üí° Think to yourself: When are they more open to you? In the morning? Right before bedtime?
text: üí° Dink by jouself: Wanneer is hulle meer oop teenoor jou? In die oggend? Direk voor slaaptyd?

SourceText: üíô Try again so that your teen can see that you care and want to spend this time with them.
text: üíô Probeer weer sodat jou tiener kan sien dat jy omgee en regtig die tyd saam met hulle wil deurbring.

SourceText: üòî It can hurt when your teen does not want to spend one-on-one-time with you.
text: üòî Dit kan seermaak wanneer jou tiener nie een-tot-een tyd saam met jou wil deurbring nie.
